verses.roman:
śukla, rakta, pīta-varṇa--ei tina dyuti
satya-tretā-kali-kāle dharena śrī-pati

synonyms: śukla—white; rakta—red; pīta-varṇa—the color yellow; ei—these; tina—three; dyuti—lusters; satya—in Satya-yuga; tretā—in Tretā-yuga; kali-kāle—in the Age of Kali; dharena—manifests; śrī-pati—the husband of the goddess of fortune.
translation: White, red and yellow-these are the three bodily lusters that the Lord, the husband of the goddess of fortune, assumes in the ages of Satya, Tretā and Kali respectively.
